title: Paul Mescal says he’s a ‘big Red Sox boy’ after falling for baseball at Fenway Park
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Celebs The Irish actor revealed in a British GQ interview that he now takes baseball “very seriously” — and credits a personal connection for his Boston fandom.
Paul Mescal has added an unexpected title to his résumé: Red Sox fan.
The Irish actor revealed in a recent British GQ interview that he has become deeply invested in Major League Baseball — and, more specifically, Boston’s team.

title: Woman kicked out of Boston hotel bathroom after being accused of being a man sues
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The women allege they were denied the right to use the bathroom “because of what Ms.
Baker looks like and because they are in a lesbian relationship.
” Ansley Baker, right, and her girlfriend, Elizabeth Victor.

title: Somerville rep. follows Minneapolis mayor’s lead in telling ICE to ‘get the f— out’

bullets: Local News Rep.
Erika Uyterhoeven called on her colleagues to pass legislation that would reign in ICE in a number of ways.

title: Key Boston boards approve new JP development with mostly affordable units
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Real Estate The 48-unit proposal drew strong community support in a neighborhood hungry for more housing.

A rendering of the proposed 294 Hyde Park Avenue apartment complex in Jamaica Plain Courtesy of Arx Urban and JGE Architecture + Design A long-empty auto parts store in Jamaica Plain is one step closer to becoming a 48-unit, mostly affordable apartment building after the project secured a critical board approval last week.
The Zoning Board of Appeals unanimously approved the project on Tuesday, following the Boston Planning Board’s December approval.

title: Mass. Senate rejects Wu’s tax shift plan
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Politics Senators did approve of a "tax shock" bill that allows municipalities to offer tax credits when property taxes rise sharply.
The Massachusetts State House in Boston.

title: 4 things Patriots must do to beat Texans in divisional round
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Utilizing Drake Maye's legs could alleviate some of the pressure that the Texans generate.
Drake Maye is going to have his hands full on Sunday against Houston.

Barry Chin/Globe Staff By Conor Ryan January 16, 2026 | 12:49 PM 6 minutes to read Drake Maye and the Patriots are set to face their toughest test of the season on Sunday afternoon at Gillette Stadium.

title: Drake Maye keeps on passing his tests. The Texans’ defense will be his hardest one yet.
author: Chad Finn
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots will have their hands full with Will Anderson Jr.
and the rest of the fearsome Texans defense, but they should be up for the challenge.
Drake Maye used his legs to help the Patriots win against a tough Chargers defense last week, and he could have to do so again with the Texans up next on Sunday.

title: ‘They’re not too complicated’: Patriots WR Kayshon Boutte downplays difficulty of facing Texans’ defense
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Morning Sports Update “I wouldn’t say one of the toughest," Boutte told reporters on if the Texans' defense is one of the hardest he's had to prepare for.
Patriots wide receiver Kayson Boutte has been a revelation this season, logging six recieiving touchdowns.

(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Roche January 16, 2026 | 11:23 AM 4 minutes to read Kayshon Boutte not fearing Texans’ defense: The Houston Texans arguably have the league’s best defense, but Kayshon Boutte isn’t intimidated by the unit ahead of the New England Patriots’ divisional round matchup against them on Sunday.
